definitions.definition: to move easily and without interruption backwards and forwards or from one side to the other, especially from a fixed point, or to cause something or someone to do this:
examples: He walked briskly along swinging his rolled-up umbrella.

definitions.definition: to move an object or your fist in an attempt to hit something or someone:

examples: His mood swings between elation and despair.
The drunk took a wild swing at Harry.
He experiences severe mood swings (= sudden changes from one extreme mood to another).
